page.title: 12THE SYTCH
page.content: The Sytch is located on the bottom right hand corner of our block. The Sytch is a wood with all kinds of trees in it. In the middle of the wood there is a little stream with bracken around it. The first man we interviewed on the local history of "The Sytch" was called Mr. Frank Evans who used the wood from "The Sytch"for his sawmill. He told us that he thought a bus came through once a week that took people to the local town of Wellington. He walks about two miles each day to the local village of Great Bolas for his newspaper. He thought that The Sytch was named after Lord Clive of India. Mr. Evans is the only person who lives on The Sytch. The nearest primary school is in Tibberton. A vast amount of trees have disappeared in the 35 years he has lived on The Sytch.
